column4: is there a good program that I can use to take remote control between a linux pc and a windows pc?
theres a few, try vncserver or krdp
and the vncserver needs to be installed on the windows right or am I wrong? and I can use the client version right
yes, for vnc thats true. krdp just uses windows remote desktop
so nothing needs installing on windows
since the other workstation is behind a router do I need to do something specific to get through?
yes youd need to open tcp 3389
is there a way to do this automaticly since the workstation that I need to take control of is from someone with very little IT experience
no, theres no automatic way. Thats the whole point of the firewall, to stop people remoting into you ;)
theres a commercial service which lets you remote in without changing router, gotomypc.co.uk or theres a few others
well maybe, but its ok for emergencies
I agree with you there but since its my uncle its difficult to explain it the correct way
yup, always a problem. it might help to find his router and then read this http://portforward.com/routers.htm
I know for me its quite simple however not for him
